definition: To catch up with someone or something, often used in the context of overtaking or surpassing them. It can also refer to retrieving or obtaining something that was previously lost or left behind.

examples.english: I have to catch up with him.
He was able to close the gap.
I will catch up with you.

examples.german: Der Läufer konnte den Führenden einholen.
examples.english: The runner was able to overtake the leader.
